intro: Veronica donii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and typically grows in open, sunny areas. It is part of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in high-altitude environments. Veronica donii is an important component of the local flora in its native range.
